column3: My Year of Rest and Relaxation

column2: Monsieur has well slept this morning, he said, smiling. "What oâ€™clock is it, Victor?" asked Dorian Gray, sleepily. "One hour and a quarter, monsieur."
Where are the ladies and gentlemen? asked Aleyn. "Sir, in the garden", said Bunce. "What time's lunch?" "One-fifteen."
The clock caught Miss LaFosseÂ´s eye. "Good heavens!" she gasped. "Look at the time. Quarter-past one. You must be starved." She turned impetuously to Miss Pettigrew.
